intro: Ricinocarpus glandulosus, commonly known as the hairy sphaerocarp, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It is a member of the family Sphaerocarpaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces distinctive, spherical fruits that are often covered in fine, glandular hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along streams. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
